name: Kai-Fu Lee
text: @mmpiatkowski Also note that non-deep tech can be nevertheless innovative and extremely profitable. Ant Financial is $100B, and Bytedance is $70B -- perhaps the two most valuable startups in the world. Both are Chinese innovative companies without deeptech or dependency on Western deeptech.

name: Kai-Fu Lee
text: @mmpiatkowski If a captive market is 3X larger than any other market, and has 3X more data per person than any other market (due to greater digitization in the society, such as IOT bicycles, mobile payment, food delivery by one e-commerce shop), then the value can be tremendous.

name: Kai-Fu Lee
text: @mmpiatkowski Chinese tech companies are valued totally about the same as the US tech companies. Their innovation approach is different but comparable to Silicon Valley. Take a look at my new book #aisuperpowers and you'll see!

name: Kai-Fu Lee
text: Most jobs today are repetitive routine - and these are exactly the AI will replace. This AI job-displacement may seem like a disaster, but it can actually save humanity - if it causes us to rethink what it means to be human. I look forward to speaking on this topic at End Well.//t.co/LSnlvCIOkA

name: Kai-Fu Lee
text: Love is what differentiates us from AI. Despite what sifi movies may portray, I can tell you responsibly that AI programs cannot love. AlphaGo may beat the world champion in Go, but the AI program felt no happiness from winning, and had no desire to hug a loved one after it won//t.co/Afo9ZUCGp2

name: Kai-Fu Lee
text: The importance of a job should not be solely dependent on its economic value, but also be measured by what it adds to society. We should reassess our notion that longer work hours are the best way to achieve success and remove the stigma associated with service pros. @kaifulee//t.co/dNPuDZnKZZ

name: Kai-Fu Lee
text: @Fidelity 12) why does your team refuse to unlock my card until I said I had a manyTwitter followers? Do you not value your reg customers?

name: Kai-Fu Lee
text: @Fidelity 11) Amex is known for quality. Does your process pass Amex quality bar? I plan to bring this up with Amex executives.

name: Kai-Fu Lee
text: @Fidelity 9) I've had the pleasure of meeting Ned Johnson 15 years ago. He cared deeply about customer experience. How would he feel?

name: Kai-Fu Lee
text: @Fidelity 8) why do I have to give my account number twice every call? What is your IT system? 10) several of your reps were not helpful

name: Kai-Fu Lee
text: @Fidelity 7) why did you lock all weekend without any ability to appeal? "Department closed" is not an acceptable excuse.

name: Kai-Fu Lee
text: @Fidelity 5) why would you ask ridiculous questions like my house number 25 years ago? 6) why do you not explain what happened and just lock

name: Kai-Fu Lee
text: @Fidelity 4) if right answers won't unlock me, why ask any questions at all? Just wasting my time. 5) why did each call take 20-60 min?

name: Kai-Fu Lee
text: @Fidelity 3) why did you ask many security questions and after correct answers still refuse to unlock me? If I answered wrong I'd understand

name: Kai-Fu Lee
text: @Fidelity pls answer: 1) why did my card remain locked after clearing it? 2) why did you ask me the same questions 3 times during 1 call?

name: Kai-Fu Lee
text: @Fidelity I look forward to hearing what "management" finds after reviewing my predicament and call log for the past week. Please email me.

name: Kai-Fu Lee
text: @Fidelity Investment's FIA Credit Card services is a total disaster. False triggering fraud locks up card all the time. Absolutely avoid.

name: Kai-Fu Lee
text: Fidelity Investment has the worst credit card in the world. I spent 3 hours on the phone with my card locked. I urge everyone to avoid.
